intro: Gongronema ventricosum, commonly known as the swollen gongronema, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, swollen stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and thickets. Gongronema ventricosum is also noted for its medicinal properties, used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
